events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred at an intersection, causing significant damage to the front end of their car.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords found in the initial report mentioning car damage and collision.
An agent specializing in auto accident claims was assigned to handle the case and assist the customer through the process.
Customer received a confirmation email acknowledging receipt of the auto accident claim and outlining the next steps.
Request sent to customer for photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and insurance policy details for claim processing.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including detailed photographs of the collision damage and official police report.
The claim investigation kicked off with an assessment of the submitted evidence and review of the accident circumstances.
Investigators confirmed that the vehicle damage was consistent with the described collision and liability was established.
A settlement offer was formulated based on repair estimates and coverage limits, then communicated to the customer.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt response and clarity of the proposed settlement terms.
The claim approval was finalized after customer acceptance, authorizing insurance payment for vehicle repairs.
Insurance payment was issued to the authorized repair shop to cover the agreed settlement amount for damages.
The auto accident claim was successfully closed after confirmation that the repair work was completed satisfactorily.
